definition: The Yellow Emperor's Internal Canon, medical text c. 300 BC
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: As early as the "Huang Di Nei Jing" there are records.
sentences.chinese: 早在《黃帝內經》就有記載。

sentences.english: Huangdi Neijing (Huangdi's Classic on Medicine )laid the foundation for formation of the Tuinaology system.
sentences.chinese: 《黃帝內經》爲按摩醫學體系白勺形成奠定了基礎。

sentences.english: The second section examines the concept "spirit" in the Huangdi Neijing.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分爲《黃帝內經》中“神”範疇的研究。

sentences.english: Chinese medicine method and theory spring from Huangdi Emperor's Internal Classic.
sentences.chinese: 中醫的方法與理論淵源於《黃帝內經》。

sentences.english: The understanding of fainting during acupuncture in Huangdi's Internal Classic was discussed.
sentences.chinese: 文章究其經文，探討《黃帝內經》對暈針的認識。

sentences.english: The collateral and collateral disease theory is based on The Canon of Internal Medicine.
sentences.chinese: 絡脈與絡病學說奠基於《黃帝內經》。

sentences.english: Many contributions were credited to Huangdi.
sentences.chinese: 他的許多貢獻都記入《黃帝內經》。

sentences.english: The second part is the wholly summary and analysis of Psychotherapy of TCM in endo-meridians.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分對《黃帝內經》心理療法進行了總結分析。

definition: traditional Chinese medical science/a doctor trained in Chinese medicine
abbr. for 黃帝內經|黄帝内经[Huang2 di4 Nei4 jing1], The Yellow Emperor's Internal Canon, medical text c. 300 BC
qi and blood (two basic bodily fluids of Chinese medicine)
overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia
evil influence/unhealthy trend/(a person's) evil air/aura of wickedness/(TCM) pathogenic energy (opposite: 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4], vital energy)
to maintain good health/to raise a child or animal/curing (of concrete etc)
five viscera of TCM, namely: heart 心[xin1], liver 肝[gan1], spleen 脾[pi2], lungs 肺[fei4] and kidneys 腎|肾[shen4]
